verses.verse: And it came<WH1961> to pass, after the year<WH8141> was expired,<WH8666> at the time<WH6256> when kings<WH4428> go<WH3318> forth<WH3318> to battle, that David<WH1732> sent<WH7971> Joab,<WH3097> and his servants<WH5650> with him, and all<WH3605> Israel;<WH3478> and they destroyed<WH7843> the children<WH1121> of Ammon,<WH5983> and besieged<WH6696> Rabbah.<WH7237> But David<WH1732> tarried<WH3427> still at Jerusalem.<WH3389>

And the woman<WH802> conceived,<WH2029> and sent<WH7971> and told<WH5046> David,<WH1732> and said,<WH559> I am with child.<WH2030>
And David<WH1732> sent<WH7971> to Joab,<WH3097> saying,<WH559> Send<WH7971> me Uriah<WH223> the Hittite.<WH2850> And Joab<WH3097> sent<WH7971> Uriah<WH223> to David.<WH1732>
And when Uriah<WH223> was come<WH935> to him, David<WH1732> demanded<WH7592> of him how Joab<WH3097> did,<WH7965> and how the people<WH5971> did,<WH7965> and how the war<WH4421> prospered.<WH7965>

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Uriah,<WH223> Go<WH3381> down<WH3381> to your house,<WH1004> and wash<WH7364> your feet.<WH7272> And Uriah<WH223> departed<WH3318> out of the king's<WH4428> house,<WH1004> and there followed<WH3318> <WH310> him a mess<WH4864> of meat from the king.<WH4428>

But Uriah<WH223> slept<WH7901> at the door<WH6607> of the king's<WH4428> house<WH1004> with all<WH3605> the servants<WH5650> of his lord,<WH113> and went<WH3381> not down<WH3381> to his house.<WH1004>

And when they had told<WH5046> David,<WH1732> saying,<WH559> Uriah<WH223> went<WH3381> not down<WH3381> to his house,<WH1004> David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Uriah,<WH223> Came<WH935> you not from your journey?<WH1870> why<WH4069> then did you not go<WH3381> down<WH3381> to your house?<WH1004>

And Uriah<WH223> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> The ark,<WH727> and Israel,<WH3478> and Judah,<WH3063> abide<WH3427> in tents;<WH5521> and my lord<WH113> Joab,<WH3097> and the servants<WH5650> of my lord,<WH113> are encamped<WH2583> in the open<WH6440> fields;<WH7704> shall I then go<WH935> into<WH413> my house,<WH1004> to eat<WH398> and to drink,<WH8354> and to lie<WH7901> with my wife?<WH802> as you live,<WH2416> and as your soul<WH5315> lives,<WH2416> I will not do<WH6213> this<WH2088> thing.<WH1697>

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Uriah,<WH223> Tarry<WH3427> here<WH2088> to day<WH3117> also,<WH1571> and to morrow<WH4279> I will let you depart.<WH7971> So Uriah<WH223> stayed<WH3427> in Jerusalem<WH3389> that day,<WH3117> and the morrow.<WH4283>

And when David<WH1732> had called<WH7121> him, he did eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354> before<WH6440> him; and he made him drunk:<WH7937> and at even<WH6153> he went<WH3318> out to lie<WH7901> on his bed<WH4904> with the servants<WH5650> of his lord,<WH113> but went<WH3381> not down<WH3381> to his house.<WH1004>
And it came<WH1961> to pass in the morning,<WH1242> that David<WH1732> wrote<WH3789> a letter<WH5612> to Joab,<WH3097> and sent<WH7971> it by the hand<WH3027> of Uriah.<WH223>

And he wrote<WH3789> in the letter,<WH5612> saying,<WH559> Set<WH3051> you Uriah<WH223> in the forefront<WH4136> <WH6440> of the hottest<WH2389> battle,<WH4421> and retire<WH7725> you from him, that he may be smitten,<WH5221> and die.<WH4191>

And it came<WH1961> to pass, when Joab<WH3097> observed<WH8104> the city,<WH5892> that he assigned<WH5414> Uriah<WH223> to a place<WH4725> where<WH834> he knew<WH3045> that valiant<WH2428> men<WH582> were.

And the men<WH582> of the city<WH5892> went<WH3318> out, and fought<WH3898> with Joab:<WH3097> and there fell<WH5307> some of the people<WH5971> of the servants<WH5650> of David;<WH1732> and Uriah<WH223> the Hittite<WH2850> died<WH4191> also.<WH1571>
Then Joab<WH3097> sent<WH7971> and told<WH5046> David<WH1732> all<WH3605> the things<WH1697> concerning the war;<WH4421>
And charged<WH6680> the messenger,<WH4397> saying,<WH559> When you have made an end<WH3615> of telling<WH1696> the matters<WH1697> of the war<WH4421> to the king,<WH4428>

And if<WH518> so be that the king's<WH4428> wrath<WH2534> arise,<WH5927> and he say<WH559> to you, Why<WH4069> approached<WH5066> you so near to the city<WH5892> when you did fight?<WH3898> knew<WH3045> you not that they would shoot<WH3384> from the wall?<WH2346>

Who<WH4310> smote<WH5221> Abimelech<WH40> the son<WH1121> of Jerubbesheth?<WH3380> did not a woman<WH802> cast<WH7993> a piece<WH6400> of a millstone<WH7393> on him from the wall,<WH2346> that he died<WH4191> in Thebez?<WH8405> why<WH4100> went<WH5066> you near<WH5066> the wall?<WH2346> then say<WH559> you, Your servant<WH5650> Uriah<WH223> the Hittite<WH2850> is dead<WH4191> also.<WH1571>
So the messenger<WH4397> went,<WH3212> and came<WH935> and showed<WH5046> David<WH1732> all<WH3605> that Joab<WH3097> had sent<WH7971> him for.

And the messenger<WH4397> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> Surely<WH3588> the men<WH582> prevailed<WH1396> against<WH5921> us, and came<WH3318> out to us into the field,<WH7704> and we were on them even to the entering<WH6607> of the gate.<WH8179>

And the shooters<WH3384> shot<WH3384> from off<WH5921> the wall<WH2346> on your servants;<WH5650> and some of the king's<WH4428> servants<WH5650> be dead,<WH4191> and your servant<WH5650> Uriah<WH223> the Hittite<WH2850> is dead<WH4191> also.<WH1571>

Then David<WH1732> said<WH559> to the messenger,<WH4397> Thus<WH3541> shall you say<WH559> to Joab,<WH3097> Let not this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> displease<WH7489> <WH5869> you, for the sword<WH2719> devours<WH398> one<WH2088> as well<WH2090> as another:<WH2090> make your battle<WH4421> more strong<WH2388> against<WH413> the city,<WH5892> and overthrow<WH2040> it: and encourage<WH2388> you him.
And when the wife<WH802> of Uriah<WH223> heard<WH8085> that Uriah<WH223> her husband<WH376> was dead,<WH4191> she mourned<WH5594> for her husband.<WH1167>

And when the mourning<WH60> was past,<WH5493> David<WH1732> sent<WH7971> and fetched<WH622> her to his house,<WH1004> and she became<WH1961> his wife,<WH802> and bore<WH3205> him a son.<WH1121> But the thing<WH1697> that David<WH1732> had done<WH6213> displeased<WH7489> <WH5869> the LORD.<WH3068>
